api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDevice.htm.title: AntDevice Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDevice.htm.summary: AntDevice Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Base class for all ANT devices. public abstract class AntDevice : ObservableObject, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Derived Tracker BicyclePower CombinedSpeedAndCadenceSensor CommonSpeedCadence FitnessEquipment Geocache HeartRate MuscleOxygen StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance UnknownDevice Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDevice.Req.title: AntDevice.RequestDataPage Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDevice.Req.summary: AntDevice.RequestDataPage Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Requests the data page. public Task<MessagingReturnCode> RequestDataPage<T>(T page, byte descriptor1 = 255, byte descriptor2 = 255, byte transmissionResponse = 4, CommandType commandType = CommandType.DataPage, ushort slaveSerialNumber = 65535) where T : Enum Parameters page T The requested page. descriptor1 byte The descriptor1. The default is 0xFF. descriptor2 byte The descriptor2. The default is 0xFF. transmissionResponse byte The transmission response. The default is to send 4 messages. commandType CommandType Type of the command. The default is DataPage. slaveSerialNumber ushort The slave serial number. The default is 0xFFFF. Returns Task<MessagingReturnCode> Status of the request. Type Parameters T The data page enumeration of the derived ANT device class. Exceptions ArgumentException Invalid data page requested.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDeviceColl.title: AntDeviceCollection.AntDeviceCollection Constructor
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDeviceColl.summary: AntDeviceCollection.AntDeviceCollection Constructor Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Initializes a new instance of the AntDeviceCollectionclass. The ANT radio is configured for continuous scan mode. public AntDeviceCollection(IAntRadio antRadio, ILoggerFactory loggerFactory, int antDeviceTimeout = 2000) Parameters antRadio IAntRadio The ANT radio interface. loggerFactory ILoggerFactory Logger factory to generate type specific ILogger from. Can be null. antDeviceTimeout int ANT device _timeout in milliseconds. The default is 2000 milliseconds. Remarks The ILoggerFactory is used to create ILogger<TCategoryName>instances for discovered ANT devices. If the factory is null, the NullLoggerFactoryis used and no logging is generated. The StartScanning()method must be called to initialize the ANT radio for continuous scan mode and setup reception of ANT messages.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDeviceColl.title: AntDeviceCollection.CollectionLock Field
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDeviceColl.summary: AntDeviceCollection.CollectionLock Field Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll The collection lock. public object CollectionLock Returns object The collection lock. Remarks An application should use the collection lock to ensure thread safe access to the collection. For example, the code behind for a WPF window should include - BindingOperations.EnableCollectionSynchronization(App.AntDevices, App.AntDevices.CollectionLock); This ensures changes to the collection are thread safe and marshalled on the UI thread.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDeviceColl.title: AntDeviceCollection Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.AntDeviceColl.summary: AntDeviceCollection Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This is a thread safe observable collection of ANT devices. public class AntDeviceCollection : ObservableCollection<AntDevice>, IList<AntDevice>, ICollection<AntDevice>, IReadOnlyList<AntDevice>, IReadOnlyCollection<AntDevice>, IEnumerable<AntDevice>, IList, ICollection, IEnumerable, INotifyCollectionChanged, INotifyPropertyChanged Inheritance object Collection<AntDevice> ObservableCollection<AntDevice> AntDeviceCollection Implements IList<AntDevice> ICollection<AntDevice> IReadOnlyList<AntDevice> IReadOnlyCollection<AntDevice> IEnumerable<AntDevice> IList ICollection IEnumerable INotifyCollectionChanged INotifyPropertyChanged Remarks This class will create an AntDevicefrom one of the supported ANT device classes and add it to the collection as they are discovered. An important consideration is when the device is no longer available. You may supply a timeout duration or the number of missed messages. You should prefer missed messages as this scales the timeout duration based on the broadcast transmission rate of the particular ANT device. The timeout/missed messages will be applied globally to ANT devices created by this collection. Constructors AntDeviceCollection(IAntRadio, ILoggerFactory, int) Initializes a new instance of the AntDeviceCollectionclass. The ANT radio is configured for continuous scan mode. For example, the code behind for a WPF window should include - BindingOperations.EnableCollectionSynchronization(assetTracker.Assets, assetTracker.CollectionLock); This ensures changes to the collection are thread safe and marshalled on the UI thread.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: Tracker Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: Tracker Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.AssetTracker Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This class supports asset trackers. public class Tracker : AntDevice, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice Tracker Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: BicyclePower Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: BicyclePower Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.BicyclePower Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Base class for bicycle power sensors. public abstract class BicyclePower : AntDevice, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice BicyclePower Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Derived CrankTorqueFrequencySensor StandardPowerSensor Remarks Bicycle Power sensors fall into two main categories - StandardPowerSensorand CrankTorqueFrequencySensor. Standard power sensors may support TorqueSensorin addition to the power only profile. The property TorqueSensor is set when a StandardCrankTorqueSensoror StandardWheelTorqueSensormessage is received. The CrankTorqueFrequencySensorclass is somewhat unique among bicycle power sensors. It provides limited commonality and functionality compared to StandardPowerSensors. Constructors BicyclePower(ChannelId, IAntChannel, ILogger, int) Initializes a new instance of the BicyclePowerclass. BicyclePower(ChannelId, IAntChannel, ILogger, TimeoutOptions?) Initializes a new instance of the BicyclePowerclass. Fields DeviceClass The device type value transmitted in the channel ID. _logger The logger for derived classes to use. (Inherited from AntDevice) Properties CalibrationStatus The calibration operation status common to all bicycle power sensors. ChannelCount This is a multiple of the base transmission frequency. All derived classes must implement this property. See the master Channel Period specified in the specific ANT device specification for the count value. ChannelId Gets the channel identifier. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.BicyclePower Namespace
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.BicyclePower Namespace Contains the bicycle power classes and members. Classes BicyclePower Base class for bicycle power sensors. CrankTorqueFrequencySensor The crank torque frequency sensor class. MeasurementOutputData Measurement data reported during calibration. StandardCrankTorqueSensor The standard bicycle power crank torque sensor class. StandardPowerSensor The standard power sensor class. Note that torque sensors report this data page for displays that may not handle torque sensor messages. StandardWheelTorqueSensor The standard bicycle power wheel torque sensor. TorqueSensor This class supports messages common to StandardCrankTorqueSensorand StandardWheelTorqueSensor. Structs StandardCrankTorqueSensor.ForceAngle Force angle structure. StandardCrankTorqueSensor.PedalPositionPage Pedal position structure. StandardPowerSensor.AdvCapabilities1 Advanced capabilities. StandardPowerSensor.AdvCapabilities2 Advanced capabilities. StandardPowerSensor.CrankParameters Various crank parameters. Enums AutoZero Auto zero status. BicyclePower.DataPage Main data pages. CalibrationResponse Response to a calibration operation. CrankTorqueFrequencySensor.CTFDefinedId Crank torque frequency defined IDs. These are used by methods that save the slope or serial number to the sensor flash or when the zero offset is reported by the sensor. MeasurementType Data type of the measurement reported. StandardCrankTorqueSensor.PedalPositionPage.Position Rider position. StandardPowerSensor.AdvCapabilities1.InteropProp Interop properties. StandardPowerSensor.AdvCapabilities1.InteroperableCapabilities Interop capabilities. StandardPowerSensor.AdvCapabilities2.InteroperableCapabilities Interoperable capabilities. StandardPowerSensor.CrankParameters.CrankLengthStatus Status of the sensor crank length. StandardPowerSensor.CrankParameters.CustomCalibrationStatus Custom calibration status. StandardPowerSensor.CrankParameters.SensorAvailabilityStatus Crank sensors available. StandardPowerSensor.CrankParameters.SensorMisMatchStatus Crank sensor firmware status. StandardPowerSensor.PedalDifferentiation Pedal power differentiation. SubPage Parameters sub-pages.

Any value not a member of this enum will return reserved.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: StandardPowerSensor.CollectionLock Field
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: StandardPowerSensor.CollectionLock Field Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.BicyclePower Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll The collection lock. public object CollectionLock Returns object The collection lock. Remarks An application should use the collection lock to ensure thread safe access to the collection. For example, the code behind for a WPF window should include - BindingOperations.EnableCollectionSynchronization(bicyclePower.Calibration.Measurements, bicyclePower.Calibration.CollectionLock); This ensures changes to the collection are thread safe and marshalled on the UI thread.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: StandardPowerSensor Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: StandardPowerSensor Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.BicyclePower Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll The standard power sensor class. Note that torque sensors report this data page for displays that may not handle torque sensor messages. public class StandardPowerSensor : BicyclePower, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice BicyclePower StandardPowerSensor Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks Bicycle Power sensors fall into two main categories - StandardPowerSensorand CrankTorqueFrequencySensor. Standard power sensors may support TorqueSensorin addition to the power only profile. The property TorqueSensor is set when a StandardCrankTorqueSensoror StandardWheelTorqueSensormessage is received. The CrankTorqueFrequencySensorclass is somewhat unique among bicycle power sensors. It provides limited commonality and functionality compared to StandardPowerSensors. Constructors StandardPowerSensor(ChannelId, IAntChannel, ILogger<StandardPowerSensor>, int) Initializes a new instance of the StandardPowerSensorclass. StandardPowerSensor(ChannelId, IAntChannel, ILogger<StandardPowerSensor>, TimeoutOptions?) Initializes a new instance of the StandardPowerSensorclass. Fields CollectionLock The collection lock. DeviceClass The device type value transmitted in the channel ID. (Inherited from BicyclePower) _logger The logger for derived classes to use. (Inherited from AntDevice) Properties AdvancedCapabilities1 Gets the advanced capabilities from the advanced setting subpage. AdvancedCapabilities2 Gets the advanced capabilities from the advanced setting subpage. AutoZeroStatus Gets the automatic zero status. AutoZeroSupported Gets a value indicating whether automatic zero is supported. AveragePower Gets the average power in watts. CalibrationData Gets the manufacturer specific calibration data. CalibrationStatus The calibration operation status common to all bicycle power sensors. (Inherited from BicyclePower) ChannelCount This is a multiple of the base transmission frequency. All derived classes must implement this property. See the master Channel Period specified in the specific ANT device specification for the count value. (Inherited from BicyclePower) ChannelId Gets the channel identifier. (Inherited from AntDevice) CombinedPedalSmoothness Set to true if left and right pedal smoothness is combined. CommonDataPages Gets the common data pages. Crank Gets the crank parameters. CustomCalibrationParameters Gets the custom calibration parameters. DeviceImageStream Gets the device image stream from the embedded resource image associated with the derived device class. InstantaneousCadence Gets the instantaneous pedaling cadence. 0xFF indicates invalid. InstantaneousPower Gets the instantaneous power in watts. LeftPedalSmoothness Gets the left pedal smoothness as a percentage. NaN indicates invalid. LeftTorqueEffectiveness Gets the left leg torque effectiveness as a percentage. NaN indicates invalid. Measurements Gets the reported measurements collection. There may be one or more measurement data types reported. Offline Gets a value indicating whether this AntDeviceis offline. (Inherited from AntDevice) PeakTorqueThreshold Gets the peak torque threshold percentage. PedalContribution Gets the pedal power contribution. PedalPower The pedal power data field provides the user’s power contribution (as a percentage) between the left and right pedals, as measured by a pedal power sensor. RiderPositionTimeOffset Gets the rider position time offset. RightPedalSmoothness Gets the right pedal smoothness as a percentage. NaN indicates invalid. Check CombinedPedalSmoothness. RightTorqueEffectiveness Gets the right leg torque effectiveness as a percentage. NaN indicates invalid. TorqueSensor Gets the torque sensor. Methods Dispose() Releases the resources used by the current instance of the class. (Inherited from AntDevice) GetParameters(SubPage) Gets the requested parameters subpage. Parse(byte[]) Parses the specified data page. RequestCustomParameters() Requests the manufacturer specific custom calibration parameters. RequestDataPage<T>(T, byte, byte, byte, CommandType, ushort) (Inherited from AntDevice) RequestManualCalibration() Requests manual calibration. (Inherited from BicyclePower) SetAutoZeroConfiguration(AutoZero) Sets the sensor automatic zero configuration. SetCrankLength(double) Sets the length of the crank or enables auto crank length. If the crank length is greater than 236.5 mm, auto crank length is enabled. Typically you would omit the length parameter to enable auto crank length. SetCustomParameters(byte[]) Sets the custom calibration parameters. This is manufacturer specified. 6 bytes must be passed in the call. SetPeakTorqueThreshold(double) Sets the peak torque threshold percentage. SetProperty<T>(ref T, T, IEqualityComparer<T>, string) (Inherited from ObservableObject) SetProperty<T>(ref T, T, string) (Inherited from ObservableObject) SetProperty<T>(T, T, Action<T>, string) (Inherited from ObservableObject) SetProperty<T>(T, T, IEqualityComparer<T>, Action<T>, string) (Inherited from ObservableObject) SetProperty<TModel, T>(T, T, IEqualityComparer<T>, TModel, Action<TModel, T>, string) (Inherited from ObservableObject) SetProperty<TModel, T>(T, T, TModel, Action<TModel, T>, string) (Inherited from ObservableObject) SetPropertyAndNotifyOnCompletion<T>(ref TaskNotifier<T>, Task<T>, Action<Task<T>>, string) (Inherited from ObservableObject) SetPropertyAndNotifyOnCompletion<T>(ref TaskNotifier<T>, Task<T>, string) (Inherited from ObservableObject) SetTransitionTimeOffset(byte) Sets the rider position transition time offset. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: StandardPowerSensor.SetPeakTorqueThreshold Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: StandardPowerSensor.SetPeakTorqueThreshold Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.BicyclePower Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Sets the peak torque threshold percentage. public Task<MessagingReturnCode> SetPeakTorqueThreshold(double threshold) Parameters threshold double The threshold percentage. Returns Task<MessagingReturnCode> Status of the request. Exceptions ArgumentOutOfRangeException Parameter threshold range is 0 to 100 percent. Remarks The percentage of the total applied torque during a time interval which is considered to be peak. Setting this value to a low percentage such as 1% will yield start and end peak torque angles in the left and right force angle pages that more closely approximate torque barycenter.At 100%, Peak Torque equals Total Torque.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: StandardPowerSensor.SetTransitionTimeOffset Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: StandardPowerSensor.SetTransitionTimeOffset Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.BicyclePower Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Sets the rider position transition time offset. public Task<MessagingReturnCode> SetTransitionTimeOffset(byte offset) Parameters offset byte The offset in seconds. Returns Task<MessagingReturnCode> Status of the request. Remarks A transition state is a state in which the power meter has detected a change from standing to sitting or sitting to standing but is uncertain whether that change is a true transition or if the transition detected is a false positive.The transition time offset specifies the time-period between when a transition is first detected until when a determination can be made as to whether the transition was successful or not.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: BikeCadenceSensor Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: BikeCadenceSensor Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.BikeSpeedAndCadence Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This class supports bike cadence sensors. public class BikeCadenceSensor : CommonSpeedCadence, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice CommonSpeedCadence BikeCadenceSensor Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: CombinedSpeedAndCadenceSensor Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: CombinedSpeedAndCadenceSensor Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.BikeSpeedAndCadence Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This class supports combined speed and cadence sensors. public class CombinedSpeedAndCadenceSensor : AntDevice, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice CombinedSpeedAndCadenceSensor Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: Climber Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: Climber Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.FitnessEquipment Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This class supports the climber fitness equipment type. public class Climber : FitnessEquipment, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice FitnessEquipment Climber Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: FitnessEquipment.GetFitnessEquipment Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: FitnessEquipment.GetFitnessEquipment Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.FitnessEquipment Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Gets the fitness equipment if the equipment type is known. public static FitnessEquipment? GetFitnessEquipment(byte[] dataPage, ChannelId channelId, IAntChannel antChannel, ILoggerFactory loggerFactory, int timeout) Parameters dataPage byte[] The data page. channelId ChannelId The channel identifier. antChannel IAntChannel The ant channel. loggerFactory ILoggerFactory The logger factory. timeout int The timeout. Returns FitnessEquipment One of the known fitness equipment classes if known, otherwise null. Remarks The specific fitness equipment type can be determined from the general data page or the FE specific data pages. Null will be returned for all other pages. Therefore, callers of this method need to check for a null return type.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: FitnessEquipment Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: FitnessEquipment Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.FitnessEquipment Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This is the primary support class for fitness equipment sensors. public abstract class FitnessEquipment : AntDevice, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice FitnessEquipment Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Derived Climber Elliptical NordicSkier Rower TrainerStationaryBike Treadmill Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. Constructors FitnessEquipment(ChannelId, IAntChannel, ILogger, int) Initializes a new instance of the FitnessEquipmentclass. FitnessEquipment(ChannelId, IAntChannel, ILogger, TimeoutOptions?) Initializes a new instance of the FitnessEquipmentclass. Fields DeviceClass The device type value transmitted in the channel ID. handledPage Flag indicating the data page was handled by Parse(byte[]). _logger The logger for derived classes to use. (Inherited from AntDevice) Properties ChannelCount This is a multiple of the base transmission frequency. All derived classes must implement this property. See the master Channel Period specified in the specific ANT device specification for the count value. ChannelId Gets the channel identifier. (Inherited from AntDevice) CommonDataPages Gets the common data pages. DeviceImageStream Gets the device image stream from the embedded resource image associated with the derived device class. GeneralData Gets the general data. GeneralMetabolic Gets the general metabolic reports. GeneralSettings Gets the general settings. MaxTrainerResistance Gets the maximum trainer resistance. Offline Gets a value indicating whether this AntDeviceis offline. (Inherited from AntDevice) State Gets the equipment state. TrainingModes Gets the supported training modes. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: FitnessEquipment.LapToggled Event
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: FitnessEquipment.LapToggled Event Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.FitnessEquipment Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Occurs when a lap toggle is signaled by the device. public event EventHandler? LapToggled Returns EventHandler Occurs when a lap toggle is signaled by the device. Remarks The event itself does not convey any information. It is the responsibility of the application/view model to capture any relevant state from the equipment and/or specific equipment for user consumption. For example, it may be useful to capture elapsed time and accumulated distance from the class.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.FitnessEquipment Namespace
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.FitnessEquipment Namespace Contains the fitness equipment classes and members. Classes Climber This class supports the climber fitness equipment type. Elliptical This class supports the elliptical fitness equipment type. FitnessEquipment This is the primary support class for fitness equipment sensors. FitnessEquipment.GeneralDataPage This class supports fitness equipment general data pages. FitnessEquipment.GeneralMetabolicPage This class supports fitness equipment general metabolic pages. FitnessEquipment.GeneralSettingsPage This class supports fitness equipment general settings pages. NordicSkier This class supports Nordic skier fitness equipment type. Rower This class supports the rower fitness equipment type. TrainerStationaryBike This class supports the stationary bike fitness equipment type. TrainerTorque This class supports trainer torque messages. Treadmill This class supports the treadmill fitness equipment type. Enums Climber.CapabilityFlags Climber specific capabilities. Elliptical.CapabilityFlags Elliptical specific capabilities. FitnessEquipment.DataPage Fitness equipment data pages. FitnessEquipment.FEState Equipment state FitnessEquipment.FitnessEquipmentType Fitness equipment type. FitnessEquipment.HRDataSource Heart rate data source FitnessEquipment.SupportedTrainingModes Supported training modes NordicSkier.CapabilityFlags Nordic skier specific capabilities. Rower.CapabilityFlags Rower specific capabilities. TrainerStationaryBike.CalibrationRequestResponse Calibration request/response flags. TrainerStationaryBike.CalibrationResult Result of the calibration request. TrainerStationaryBike.SpeedCondition Current reported speed condition. TrainerStationaryBike.TargetPowerLimit Used by trainers operating in target power mode. TrainerStationaryBike.TemperatureCondition Current reported temperature condition. TrainerStationaryBike.TrainerStatusField The trainer status bit field is used to indicate whether the trainer requires calibration and/or configuration data to be sent. Treadmill.CapabilityFlags Treadmill specific capabilities.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: Rower Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: Rower Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.FitnessEquipment Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This class supports the rower fitness equipment type. public class Rower : FitnessEquipment, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice FitnessEquipment Rower Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: Treadmill Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: Treadmill Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles.FitnessEquipment Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This class supports the treadmill fitness equipment type. public class Treadmill : FitnessEquipment, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice FitnessEquipment Treadmill Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: Geocache.Geocache Constructor
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: Geocache.Geocache Constructor Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Geocache(ChannelId, IAntChannel, ILogger<Geocache>, int) Initializes a new instance of the Geocacheclass. public Geocache(ChannelId channelId, IAntChannel antChannel, ILogger<Geocache> logger, int timeout) Parameters channelId ChannelId The channel identifier. antChannel IAntChannel Channel to send messages to. logger ILogger<Geocache> Logger to use. timeout int Time in milliseconds before firing DeviceWentOffline. To disable the device timeout, set the timeout argument to -1 and skip setting the missedMessages argument. Remarks The geocache typically broadcasts its presence at 0.5Hz. The geocache changes its message rate to 4Hz upon receiving a request such as RequestPinPage(). Set the timeout appropriate for your use case. Geocache(ChannelId, IAntChannel, ILogger<Geocache>, TimeoutOptions?) Remarks The geocache typically broadcasts its presence at 0.5Hz. The geocache changes its message rate to 4Hz upon receiving a request such as RequestPinPage(). Set the timeout appropriate for your use case.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: HeartRate Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: HeartRate Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll The HeartRate class provides full support for ANT+ heart rate monitors. This profile is specified in the document ANT+ Managed Network Document – ANT+ Heart Rate Device Profile, Rev 2.5, © 2006-2022 Garmin Canada Inc. All Rights Reserved. public class HeartRate : AntDevice, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice HeartRate Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks Due to the ubiquity of heart rate monitors and manufacturers, several problems present themselves with regard to this specification. This primarily relates to group workout environments (clubs). These issues do not exist for individual workout environments (homes). Because of the limitations posed by the channel ID it is a distinct possibility that different HRM's will have the same channel ID. There is no guarantee the channel ID is unique to a specific device. There is no guarantee the background page sent is unique to a specific device. RequestCapabilities will be broadcast to all devices with the same channel ID. You may receive multiple contradictory replies. SetSportMode will be broadcast to all devices with the same channel ID. This is not an issue if the invocation is local to the group involved. Keep these caveats in mind when designing your application. Applications designed for group environments may choose to only attach to the manufacturer event and ignore other background pages. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: HeartRate.SetHRFeature Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: HeartRate.SetHRFeature Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Updates the heart rate sensor feature. The HR Feature command page is sent from a display to a heart rate monitor when the display wants to update the enabled status of a HR feature. public Task<MessagingReturnCode> SetHRFeature(bool applyGymMode, bool gymMode) Parameters applyGymMode bool if set to trueapply gym mode. Displays cannot rely on this field as older sensors do not decode it. The Gym Mode bit shall be set to the last received value from the capabilities page if Apply Gym Mode is set to false. gymMode bool if set to truegym mode is enabled. Returns Task<MessagingReturnCode> Status of the request. Remarks Gym mode helps a single group receiver running a continuous scan differentiate between many transmitting heart rate monitors; a common problem encountered in gym-based group fitness applications.This is achieved by transmitting data page 2 as a main data page.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles Namespace
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles Namespace This namespace contains supported ANT+ device profiles. Classes Geocache This class supports geocaches. This is specified in ANT+ Managed Network Document – Geocache Device Profile. HeartRate The HeartRate class provides full support for ANT+ heart rate monitors. This profile is specified in the document ANT+ Managed Network Document – ANT+ Heart Rate Device Profile, Rev 2.5, © 2006-2022 Garmin Canada Inc. All Rights Reserved. MuscleOxygen This class supports muscle oxygen sensors. This profile is specified in ANT+ Managed Network Document – Muscle Oxygen Device Profile, Rev 1.1. StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance The stride based speed and distance monitor (SDM) class. The SDM is a personal body-worn device that allows the wearer to measure the number of strides taken, the speed at which they are traveling and/or the distance they have covered based on stride measurements and calculations.Some examples of SDMs include the foot-worn pods that go on, or in, a shoe and reconstruct strides to compute speed and distance while walking or running.Similarly, pedometers that may be worn on the waist or elsewhere are also considered SDMs. UnknownDevice This class supports unknown devices. Structs HeartRate.BatteryStatusPage The battery status page. Sent as a background page. HeartRate.CapabilitiesPage Heart rate device capabilities HeartRate.CommonHeartRateData Heart rate data common to all data pages. HeartRate.ManufacturerInfoPage Manufacturer supplied info. It may be sent as a main page or background page. HeartRate.ManufacturerSpecificPage This structure provides manufacturer specific data. Sent as a background page. HeartRate.PreviousHeartBeatPage This structure provides the RR interval and manufacturer specific data. It is typically sent as a main page. HeartRate.ProductInfoPage Product information. Sent as a background page. All fields are manufacturer specific. HeartRate.SwimIntervalPage Swim interval data MuscleOxygen.SaturatedHemoglobin Saturated hemoglobin structure. MuscleOxygen.TotalHemoglobin Total hemoglobin structure. StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance.StatusFlags The SDM status flags. Enums Geocache.DataPage Main data pages. HeartRate.DataPage Heart rate device data pages. HeartRate.Features Supported feature flags from the capabilities page. HeartRate.HeartbeatEventType Heart beat event types. MuscleOxygen.CommandId Command identifiers. MuscleOxygen.MeasurementInterval The measurement interval used. MuscleOxygen.MeasurementStatus Measurement status. StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance.BatteryStatus SDM battery status. StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance.CapabilitiesFlags Sensor broadcast capabilities. StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance.DataPage SDM device data pages. StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance.HealthStatus SDM health status. StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance.SDMLocation SDM location on the body. StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance.UseState SDM active state.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: MuscleOxygen Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: MuscleOxygen Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This class supports muscle oxygen sensors. This profile is specified in ANT+ Managed Network Document – Muscle Oxygen Device Profile, Rev 1.1. public class MuscleOxygen : AntDevice, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice MuscleOxygen Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll The stride based speed and distance monitor (SDM) class. The SDM is a personal body-worn device that allows the wearer to measure the number of strides taken, the speed at which they are traveling and/or the distance they have covered based on stride measurements and calculations.Some examples of SDMs include the foot-worn pods that go on, or in, a shoe and reconstruct strides to compute speed and distance while walking or running.Similarly, pedometers that may be worn on the waist or elsewhere are also considered SDMs. public class StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance : AntDevice, INotifyPropertyChanged, INotifyPropertyChanging, IDisposable Inheritance object ObservableObject AntDevice StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance Implements INotifyPropertyChanged INotifyPropertyChanging IDisposable Remarks An important consideration is an appropriate timeout to determine if a device has gone offline - battery has died, device has been turned off, device is out of range of receiver, ane/or the RF environment the device and receiver are operating in. Most devices broadcast at 4Hz, with the notable exception of Geocacheand Asset Tracker. A reasonable rule of thumb is to set the timeout at 8 messages times the channel period per second; typically 2 seconds. Consult the device profile documentation at https://www.thisisant.com for a device and consult the channel period defined for master devices. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.title: StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance.RequestBroadcastCapabilities Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfile.summary: StrideBasedSpeedAndDistance.RequestBroadcastCapabilities Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.DeviceProfiles Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Requests the SDM broadcast capabilities page. public Task<MessagingReturnCode> RequestBroadcastCapabilities() Returns Task<MessagingReturnCode> Status of the request. Remarks Page 22 is used to indicate the specific broadcast data capabilities of a sensor. The SDM shall be able to transmit the capabilities page upon request. Note that legacy SDMs were only required to support Page 22 if any of Calories, Cadence, Latency, Speed, Distance, or Time Stamp fields were not supported; therefore, displays shall gracefully handle not receiving a capabilities page when requested.If a capabilities page is not received, the display should assume that all the prior mentioned capabilities are supported and nothing else.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.Extensions.Lo.title: LoggerExtensions Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.Extensions.Lo.summary: LoggerExtensions Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.Extensions.Logging Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll Provides extension methods for logging used in the AntPlus class library and the hosting extensions library. The design goal is to provide a consistent logging experience across the libraries and good performance. public static class LoggerExtensions Inheritance object LoggerExtensions Remarks The public methods in this class perform the required parameter conversions and call the private methods decorated with the LoggerMessageAttributeattribute. LogUnknownDataPage and LogUnknownDataPage<TEnum> are used to log unknown data pages from an ANT device. Use LogUnknownDataPage when the data page value at page index 0 is not supported by the derived AntDevice parser. Use LogUnknownDataPage<TEnum> when a data page value at some other index is not supported by the derived AntDevice parser. Methods LogAntCollectionChange(ILogger, AntDevice, string) Logs a change in the ANT device collection. The log level is Debug. LogAntDeviceState(ILogger, AntDevice, int, string) Logs the state of an ANT device. The log level is Debug. LogAntResponse(ILogger, LogLevel, AntResponse, string) Logs an ANT response. Null payloads are logged as "Null". LogDataPage(ILogger, LogLevel, byte[], string) Logs a data page. LogDataPage<TEnum>(ILogger, LogLevel, byte, byte[], string) Logs a data page. LogIgnoredDataPage<TEnum>(ILogger, byte[], string) Logs a warning message indicating an ignored or unexpected page. LogMethodEntry(ILogger, string) Logs a method entry. The log level is Debug. LogSendAcknowledgedMessage(ILogger, int, uint, byte[], MessagingReturnCode?, string) Logs a debug message about sending an acknowledged message. LogUnhandledAntResponse(ILogger, AntResponse, string) Logs an unhandled ANT response. Null payloads are logged as "Null". LogUnknownDataPage(ILogger, byte[], string) Logs a warning message indicating an unknown data page. LogUnknownDataPage<TEnum>(ILogger, byte, byte[], string) Logs a warning message indicating an unknown data page deeper in the device parsing hierarchy.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.html.title: SmallEarthTech.AntPlus Namespace
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.html.summary: SmallEarthTech.AntPlus Namespace This is the global namespace for ANT+ devices. Classes AntDevice Base class for all ANT devices. AntDeviceCollection This is a thread safe observable collection of ANT devices. CommonDataPages This class supports common data pages. In particular, this class describes the common pages used by ANT+ devices. TimeoutOptions This class provides timeout options. The AntCollection class uses the options pattern and propagates a timeout to AntDevices that are instantiated by AntCollection. Utils A static class with useful methods for calculations. Structs CommonDataPages.BatteryStatusPage Battery status page. CommonDataPages.CommandStatusPage The command status page. CommonDataPages.ErrorDescriptionPage Error description structure. CommonDataPages.SubfieldDataPage Subfield data page. Enums BatteryStatus Battery status description. CommandType Data page command type. CommonDataPage Supported common data pages. CommonDataPages.CommandResult Command result. CommonDataPages.ErrorLevel Severity of error. CommonDataPages.MemorySizeUnit Memory size unit used. CommonDataPages.SubfieldDataPage.SubPage The subfield data page type. SportMode Use this enumeration to set the desired sport mode. api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.TimeoutOption.title: TimeoutOptions Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.TimeoutOption.summary: TimeoutOptions Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntPlus Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntPlus.dll This class provides timeout options. The AntCollection class uses the options pattern and propagates a timeout to AntDevices that are instantiated by AntCollection. public sealed class TimeoutOptions Inheritance object TimeoutOptions Remarks The application host builder retrieves configuration options from various sources such as the command line or appsettings.json. If the configuration can't find TimeoutOptions, the collection will default to MissedMessages. If both Timeoutand MissedMessagesare defined, Timeout is ignored and MissedMessages is used. Prefer MissedMessages as this will scale the ANT device timeout based on the specific data broadcast rate of an ANT device. Asset trackers broadcast 16 times a second and Geocaches broadcast once every 2 seconds. Other devices typically broadcast 4 times a second. For example, your appsettings.json file would have this entry - { "TimeoutOptions": { "MissedMessages": 8, "Timeout": null } } The command line could define the timeout "--TimeoutOptions:MissedMessages=8". Timeouts can be disabled by setting Timeout to -1 and ignoring or setting MissedMessages to null. Properties MissedMessages Gets or sets the number of missed messages before an ANT device goes offline. Timeout Gets or sets the timeout before an ANT device goes offline.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.Cha.title: ChannelId Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.Cha.summary: ChannelId Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.dll The channel ID is a concrete class comprised of device number, device type, and transmission type. [DataContract] public class ChannelId Inheritance object ChannelId Remarks The channel identifier is received in ANT packets as a 32 bit number. Extended messages need to be enabled. Use the Id property for messages transmitted to an ANT device. This is handled automatically in the device profiles. Constructors ChannelId(uint) Initializes a new instance of the ChannelIdstruct. Properties AreGlobalDataPagesUsed Gets a value indicating whether global data pages are used. DeviceNumber Gets the device number. DeviceType Gets the type of the device. Id Gets the channel identifier. IsPairingBitSet Gets a value indicating whether this instance has the pairing bit set. TransmissionType Gets the type of the transmission.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.htm.title: SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Namespace
api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.htm.summary: SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Namespace The ANT+ radio interface namespace. Classes AntResponse Derive from AntResponse to support a concrete implementation (i.e. USB ANT radio). ChannelId The channel ID is a concrete class comprised of device number, device type, and transmission type. DeviceCapabilities The radio capabilities class. Structs ChannelStatus Contains the information returned by a channel status request message Interfaces IAntChannel The ANT channel interface. IAntConfiguration This interface defines common ANT radio configuration commands. IAntControl This interface defines ANT radio control messages and status requests. IAntRadio ANT radio interface. IAntUsbRadio This interface is used for ANT radios specifically connected to the host USB ports. ICrypto This interface defines ANT encryption commands. IFitSettings This interface controls general FIT equipped devices. Enums AdvancedBurstConfigFlags Flags for configuring advanced bursting features. BasicChannelStatusCode Basic Channel status message codes, the bottom two bits of the received status message. ChannelSharing ANT channel sharing enumeration. This is obtained from the transmission type in the channel ID. ChannelType Channel Type flags. A valid channel type is one BASE parameter (Slave XOR Receive) combined by '|' (bitwise OR) with any desired ADV parameters ChannelTypeExtended The extended channel type enum. EncryptionInfo Encryption information. EncryptionNVMOp Encryption non-volatile memory operations. EventBufferConfig Event groups for configuring Event Buffering EventMsgId Channel event message identifier. FlagByte Flag byte enumeration. LibConfigFlags Flags for configuring device ANT library MessageId Message identifier of the received data. MessagingReturnCode The int status codes returned by the acknowledged and broadcast messaging functions. RequestMessageID Message ID to request message. Note: Where desired, raw byte values can be cast to the enum type. IE: (RequestMessageID)0x4Ewill compile. ResponseMsgId Channel response message identifier. TransmitPower Transmit power offsets.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.title: IAntChannel.AssignChannel Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.summary: IAntChannel.AssignChannel Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.dll Assign an ANT channel along with its main parameters. Throws exception if the network number is invalid. bool AssignChannel(ChannelType channelTypeByte, byte networkNumber, uint responseWaitTime) Parameters channelTypeByte ChannelType Channel Type byte networkNumber byte Network to assign to channel, must be less than device's max networks-1 responseWaitTime uint Time to wait for device success response Returns bool True on success. Note: Always returns true with a response time of 0

Note: Always returns true with a response time of 0

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.summary: IAntChannel.ConfigFrequencyAgility Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.dll This function configures the three operating RF frequencies for ANT frequency agility mode and should be used with the AdvFrequencyAgility extended channel assignment flag. Should not be used with shared, or Tx/Rx only channel types. This feature is not available on all ANT devices. bool ConfigFrequencyAgility(byte freq1, byte freq2, byte freq3, uint responseWaitTime) Parameters freq1 byte Operating RF frequency 1 freq2 byte Operating RF frequency 2 freq3 byte Operating RF frequency 3 responseWaitTime uint Time to wait for device success response Returns bool True on success. Note: Always returns true with a response time of 0

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.title: IAntChannel Interface
api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.summary: IAntChannel Interface Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.dll The ANT channel interface. public interface IAntChannel : IDisposable Properties ChannelNumber Gets the channel number. Methods AssignChannel(ChannelType, byte, uint) Assign an ANT channel along with its main parameters. Throws exception if the network number is invalid. AssignChannelExt(ChannelType, byte, ChannelTypeExtended, uint) Assign an ANT channel, using extended channel assignment Throws exception if the network number is invalid. CloseChannel(uint) Close this channel ConfigFrequencyAgility(byte, byte, byte, uint) This function configures the three operating RF frequencies for ANT frequency agility mode and should be used with the AdvFrequencyAgility extended channel assignment flag. Should not be used with shared, or Tx/Rx only channel types. This feature is not available on all ANT devices. IncludeExcludeListAddChannel(ChannelId, byte, uint) Add the given channel ID to the channel's inclusion/exclusion list. The channelID is then included or excluded from the wild card search depending on how the list is configured. Throws exception if listIndex > 3. IncludeExcludeListConfigure(byte, bool, uint) Configures the inclusion/exclusion list. If isExclusionList is true the channel IDs will be excluded from any wild card search on this channel. Otherwise the IDs are the only IDs accepted in the search. Throws exception if list size is greater than 4. OpenChannel(uint) Opens this channel RequestChannelID(uint) Requests the channel identifier. RequestStatus(uint) Returns current channel status. Throws exception on timeout. SendAcknowledgedData(byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an acknowledged transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendAcknowledgedDataAsync(byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an acknowledged transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendBroadcastData(byte[]) Sends the given data on the broadcast transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendBurstTransfer(byte[], uint) Sends the given data as a burst transmission. Returns: 0=fail, 1=pass, 2=timeout, 3=cancelled SendBurstTransferAsync(byte[], uint) Sends the given data as a burst transmission. Returns: 0=fail, 1=pass, 2=timeout, 3=cancelled SendExtAcknowledgedData(ChannelId, byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an extended acknowledged transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendExtAcknowledgedDataAsync(ChannelId, byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an extended acknowledged transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendExtBroadcastData(ChannelId, byte[]) Sends the given data as an extended broadcast transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendExtBurstTransfer(ChannelId, byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an extended burst transmission. Returns: 0=fail, 1=pass, 2=timeout, 3=cancelled SendExtBurstTransferAsync(ChannelId, byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an extended burst transmission. Returns: 0=fail, 1=pass, 2=timeout, 3=cancelled SetChannelFreq(byte, uint) Set this channel's RF frequency, with the given offset from 2400Mhz. Note: Changing this frequency may affect the ability to certify the product in certain areas of the world. SetChannelID(ChannelId, uint) Set the Channel ID of this channel. Throws exception if device type is > 127. SetChannelID_UsingSerial(ChannelId, uint) Identical to setChannelID, except last two bytes of serial number are used for device number. Not available on all ANT devices. Throws exception if device type is > 127. SetChannelPeriod(ushort, uint) Set this channel's messaging period SetChannelSearchTimeout(byte, uint) Set the search timeout SetChannelTransmitPower(TransmitPower, uint) Set the transmission power of this channel Throws exception if device is not capable of per-channel transmit power. SetLowPrioritySearchTimeout(byte, uint) Sets the search timeout for the channel's low-priority search, where it will not interrupt other open channels. When this period expires the channel will drop to high-priority search. This feature is not available in all ANT devices. SetProximitySearch(byte, uint) Enables a one time proximity requirement for searching. Only ANT devices within the set proximity bin can be acquired. Search threshold values are not correlated to specific distances as this will be dependent on the system design. This feature is not available on all ANT devices. Throws exception if given bin value is > 10. SetSearchThresholdRSSI(byte, uint) Set this channel's RSSI threshold (ARCT) UnassignChannel(uint) Unassign this channel. Events ChannelResponse The channel response event. Triggered every time a message is received from the ANT device.

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.title: IAntChannel.IncludeExcludeListAddChannel Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.summary: IAntChannel.IncludeExcludeListAddChannel Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.dll Add the given channel ID to the channel's inclusion/exclusion list. The channelID is then included or excluded from the wild card search depending on how the list is configured. Throws exception if listIndex > 3. bool IncludeExcludeListAddChannel(ChannelId channelId, byte listIndex, uint responseWaitTime) Parameters channelId ChannelId Channel ID assigned to a device listIndex byte position in inclusion/exclusion list to add channelID at (Max size of list is 4) responseWaitTime uint Time to wait for device success response Returns bool True on success. Note: Always returns true with a response time of 0

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.summary: IAntChannel.IncludeExcludeListConfigure Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.dll Configures the inclusion/exclusion list. If isExclusionList is true the channel IDs will be excluded from any wild card search on this channel. Otherwise the IDs are the only IDs accepted in the search. Throws exception if list size is greater than 4. bool IncludeExcludeListConfigure(byte listSize, bool isExclusionList, uint responseWaitTime) Parameters listSize byte The desired size of the list, max size is 4, 0=none isExclusionList bool True = exclusion list, False = inclusion list responseWaitTime uint Time to wait for device success response Returns bool True on success. Note: Always returns true with a response time of 0

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.title: IAntChannel.SetProximitySearch Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.summary: IAntChannel.SetProximitySearch Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.dll Enables a one time proximity requirement for searching. Only ANT devices within the set proximity bin can be acquired. Search threshold values are not correlated to specific distances as this will be dependent on the system design. This feature is not available on all ANT devices. Throws exception if given bin value is > 10. bool SetProximitySearch(byte thresholdBin, uint responseWaitTime) Parameters thresholdBin byte Threshold bin. Value from 0-10 (0= disabled). A search threshold value of 1 (i.e. bin 1) will yield the smallest radius search and is generally recommended as there is less chance of connecting to the wrong device. responseWaitTime uint Time to wait for device success response Returns bool True on success. Note: Always returns true with a response time of 0

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.title: IAntRadio.GetDeviceCapabilities Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.summary: IAntRadio.GetDeviceCapabilities Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.dll Gets the device capabilities of the ANT radio. Task<DeviceCapabilities> GetDeviceCapabilities(bool forceNewCopy = false, uint responseWaitTime = 1500) Parameters forceNewCopy bool If set to trueforce new copy. The default is false. responseWaitTime uint The response wait time in milliseconds. The default is 1500ms. Returns Task<DeviceCapabilities> A task encapsulating the DeviceCapabilities Remarks Default arguments are provided by the method interface and are inherited by concrete implementations of IAntRadio. It is unlikely the default arguments need to be overridden. Typically a copy of the DeviceCapabilitiesis maintained in the concrete implementation of the ANT radio and the response wait time only needs to be overridden if there a large latencies getting the response. Use a named argument if you only need to specify a different response wait time - e.g. GetDeviceCapabilities(responseWaitTime: 2000).

api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.title: IAntRadio.InitializeContinuousScanMode Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.IAn.summary: IAntRadio.InitializeContinuousScanMode Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntRadioInterface.dll Initializes the ANT radio for continuous scan mode. Task<IAntChannel[]> InitializeContinuousScanMode() Returns Task<IAntChannel[]> Returns an array of ANT channels. The first element of the array (ANT channel 0) is used for continuous scan mode to receive broadcast messages from ANT master devices. The remaining channels should be configured so messages may be sent to ANT master devices. Examples Implementors typically would perform the following setup - public Task<IAntChannel[]> InitializeContinuousScanMode() { // multiple clients may attempt to initialize lock (_lock) { // test if channels have not been allocated (first time initialization) if (_channels.Length == 0) { // allocate channels for this radio _logger.LogInformation("Allocating channels for continuous scan mode."); _channels = new IAntChannel[NumChannels]; // configure channel 0 for continuous scan mode SetNetworkKey(0, new byte[] { 0xB9, 0xA5, 0x21, 0xFB, 0xBD, 0x72, 0xC3, 0x45 }); EnableRxExtendedMessages(true); _channels[0] = GetChannel(0); _channels[0].AssignChannel(ChannelType.BaseSlaveReceive, 0, 500); _channels[0].SetChannelID(new ChannelId(0), 500); _channels[0].SetChannelFreq(57, 500); OpenRxScanMode(); // assign channels for devices to use for sending messages for (int i = 1; i < NumChannels; i++) { _channels[i] = GetChannel(i); _ = _channels[i].AssignChannel(ChannelType.BaseSlaveReceive, 0, 500); } } } return Task.FromResult(_channels); }

api/SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.AntChanne.title: AntChannel Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.AntChanne.summary: AntChannel Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.dll This class implements the IAntChannel interface. public class AntChannel : IAntChannel, IDisposable Inheritance object AntChannel Implements IAntChannel IDisposable Properties ChannelNumber Gets the channel number. Methods AssignChannel(ChannelType, byte, uint) Assign an ANT channel along with its main parameters. Throws exception if the network number is invalid. AssignChannelExt(ChannelType, byte, ChannelTypeExtended, uint) Assign an ANT channel, using extended channel assignment Throws exception if the network number is invalid. CloseChannel(uint) Close this channel ConfigFrequencyAgility(byte, byte, byte, uint) This function configures the three operating RF frequencies for ANT frequency agility mode and should be used with the AdvFrequencyAgility extended channel assignment flag. Should not be used with shared, or Tx/Rx only channel types. This feature is not available on all ANT devices. Dispose() Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class. IncludeExcludeListAddChannel(ChannelId, byte, uint) Add the given channel ID to the channel's inclusion/exclusion list. The channelID is then included or excluded from the wild card search depending on how the list is configured. Throws exception if listIndex > 3. IncludeExcludeListConfigure(byte, bool, uint) Configures the inclusion/exclusion list. If isExclusionList is true the channel IDs will be excluded from any wild card search on this channel. Otherwise the IDs are the only IDs accepted in the search. Throws exception if list size is greater than 4. OpenChannel(uint) Opens this channel RequestChannelID(uint) Requests the channel identifier. RequestStatus(uint) Returns current channel status. Throws exception on timeout. SendAcknowledgedData(byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an acknowledged transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendAcknowledgedDataAsync(byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an acknowledged transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendBroadcastData(byte[]) Sends the given data on the broadcast transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendBurstTransfer(byte[], uint) Sends the given data as a burst transmission. Returns: 0=fail, 1=pass, 2=timeout, 3=cancelled SendBurstTransferAsync(byte[], uint) Sends the given data as a burst transmission. Returns: 0=fail, 1=pass, 2=timeout, 3=cancelled SendExtAcknowledgedData(ChannelId, byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an extended acknowledged transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendExtAcknowledgedDataAsync(ChannelId, byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an extended acknowledged transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendExtBroadcastData(ChannelId, byte[]) Sends the given data as an extended broadcast transmission. Throws exception if data > 8-bytes in length SendExtBurstTransfer(ChannelId, byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an extended burst transmission. Returns: 0=fail, 1=pass, 2=timeout, 3=cancelled SendExtBurstTransferAsync(ChannelId, byte[], uint) Sends the given data as an extended burst transmission. Returns: 0=fail, 1=pass, 2=timeout, 3=cancelled SetChannelFreq(byte, uint) Set this channel's RF frequency, with the given offset from 2400Mhz. Note: Changing this frequency may affect the ability to certify the product in certain areas of the world. SetChannelID(ChannelId, uint) Set the Channel ID of this channel. Throws exception if device type is > 127. SetChannelID_UsingSerial(ChannelId, uint) Identical to setChannelID, except last two bytes of serial number are used for device number. Not available on all ANT devices. Throws exception if device type is > 127. SetChannelPeriod(ushort, uint) Set this channel's messaging period SetChannelSearchTimeout(byte, uint) Set the search timeout SetChannelTransmitPower(TransmitPower, uint) Set the transmission power of this channel Throws exception if device is not capable of per-channel transmit power. SetLowPrioritySearchTimeout(byte, uint) Sets the search timeout for the channel's low-priority search, where it will not interrupt other open channels. When this period expires the channel will drop to high-priority search. This feature is not available in all ANT devices. SetProximitySearch(byte, uint) Enables a one time proximity requirement for searching. Only ANT devices within the set proximity bin can be acquired. Search threshold values are not correlated to specific distances as this will be dependent on the system design. This feature is not available on all ANT devices. Throws exception if given bin value is > 10. SetSearchThresholdRSSI(byte, uint) Set this channel's RSSI threshold (ARCT) UnassignChannel(uint) Unassign this channel. Events ChannelResponse The channel response event. Triggered every time a message is received from the ANT device.

When this period expires the channel will drop to high-priority search. This feature is not available in all ANT devices. public bool SetLowPrioritySearchTimeout(byte lowPriorityTimeout, uint responseWaitTime) Parameters lowPriorityTimeout byte Timeout period in 2.5 second units responseWaitTime uint Time to wait for device success response Returns bool True on success. Note: Always returns true with a response time of 0

api/SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.AntChanne.title: AntChannel.SetProximitySearch Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.AntChanne.summary: AntChannel.SetProximitySearch Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.dll Enables a one time proximity requirement for searching. Only ANT devices within the set proximity bin can be acquired. Search threshold values are not correlated to specific distances as this will be dependent on the system design. This feature is not available on all ANT devices. Throws exception if given bin value is > 10. public bool SetProximitySearch(byte thresholdBin, uint responseWaitTime) Parameters thresholdBin byte Threshold bin. Value from 0-10 (0= disabled). A search threshold value of 1 (i.e. bin 1) will yield the smallest radius search and is generally recommended as there is less chance of connecting to the wrong device. responseWaitTime uint Time to wait for device success response Returns bool True on success. Note: Always returns true with a response time of 0

api/SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.AntRadio..title: AntRadio.GetDeviceCapabilities Method
api/SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.AntRadio..summary: AntRadio.GetDeviceCapabilities Method Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.dll Gets the device capabilities of the ANT radio. public Task<DeviceCapabilities> GetDeviceCapabilities(bool forceNewCopy = false, uint responseWaitTime = 1500) Parameters forceNewCopy bool If set to trueforce new copy. The default is false. responseWaitTime uint The response wait time in milliseconds. The default is 1500ms. Returns Task<DeviceCapabilities> A task encapsulating the DeviceCapabilities Remarks Default arguments are provided by the method interface and are inherited by concrete implementations of IAntRadio. It is unlikely the default arguments need to be overridden. Typically a copy of the DeviceCapabilitiesis maintained in the concrete implementation of the ANT radio and the response wait time only needs to be overridden if there a large latencies getting the response. Use a named argument if you only need to specify a different response wait time - e.g. GetDeviceCapabilities(responseWaitTime: 2000).

api/SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.AntRadio..title: AntRadio Class
api/SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.AntRadio..summary: AntRadio Class Definition Namespace SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick Assembly SmallEarthTech.AntUsbStick.dll This class implements the IAntRadio interface. public class AntRadio : IAntConfiguration, IAntControl, IAntRadio, IDisposable, IAntUsbRadio, ICrypto, IFitSettings Inheritance object AntRadio Implements IAntConfiguration IAntControl IAntRadio IDisposable IAntUsbRadio ICrypto IFitSettings Constructors AntRadio(ILogger<AntRadio>) Initializes a new instance of the AntRadioclass. Properties NumChannels Gets the number of channels supported by the ANT radio. ProductDescription Gets the ANT radio product description. SerialNumber Gets the serial number. Version Gets the radio version string. Methods CancelTransfers(int) Cancels the transfers. ConfigureAdvancedBursting(bool, byte, AdvancedBurstConfigFlags, AdvancedBurstConfigFlags, uint) Configures the advanced bursting. ConfigureAdvancedBursting_ext(bool, byte, AdvancedBurstConfigFlags, AdvancedBurstConfigFlags, ushort, byte, uint) Configures the extended advanced bursting. ConfigureAdvancedBurstSplitting(bool) Configures the advanced burst splitting. ConfigureEventBuffer(EventBufferConfig, ushort, ushort, uint) Configures the event buffer. ConfigureEventFilter(ushort, uint) Configures the event filter. ConfigureHighDutySearch(bool, byte, uint) Configures the high duty search. ConfigureUserNvm(ushort, byte[], byte, uint) Configures the user NVM. CryptoKeyNVMOp(EncryptionNVMOp, byte, byte[], uint) Crypto key NVM operation. CrystalEnable(uint) Crystal enable. Dispose() Releases all resources used by the current instance of the class. EnableLED(bool, uint) Enables the LED. EnableRxExtendedMessages(bool, uint) Enables Rx extended messages. FitAdjustPairingSettings(byte, byte, byte, uint) FIT adjust pairing settings. FitSetFEState(byte, uint) FIT set the state of the fitness equipment. GetBaudRate() Gets the opened USB baud rate. GetChannel(int) Gets the channel. GetDeviceCapabilities(bool, uint) Gets the device capabilities of the ANT radio. GetDeviceNum() Gets the opened USB device number. GetPID() Gets the device USB PID. GetProductDescription() Gets the USB device product description. GetSerialString() Gets the USB device serial number string. GetVID() Gets the device USB VID. InitializeContinuousScanMode() Initializes the ANT radio for continuous scan mode. LoadCryptoKeyFromNVM(byte, byte, uint) Loads the crypto key from NVM. OpenRxScanMode(uint) Open channel 0 in continuous scan mode. Channel 0 should have been previously assigned and configured as a slave receive channel. ReadUserNvm(ushort, byte, uint) Reads the user NVM. RequestMessage(RequestMessageID, byte) This message is sent to the ANT radio to request specific information from the radio. RequestMessageAndResponse(RequestMessageID, uint, byte) Requests a message and waits to return the response. ResetSystem(uint) Resets the ANT radio. ResetUSB() Resets the ANT radio USB interface. SetCryptoID(byte[], uint) Sets the crypto identifier. SetCryptoInfo(EncryptionInfo, byte[], uint) Sets the crypto information. SetCryptoKey(byte, byte[], uint) Sets the crypto key. SetCryptoRNGSeed(byte[], uint) Sets the crypto RNG seed. SetCryptoUserInfo(byte[], uint) Sets the crypto user information. SetLibConfig(LibConfigFlags, uint) Sets the library configuration. SetNetworkKey(byte, byte[], uint) Sets the network key. SetTransmitPowerForAllChannels(TransmitPower, uint) Sets the transmit power for all channels. StoreCryptoKeyToNVM(byte, byte[], uint) Stores the crypto key to NVM. WriteRawMessageToDevice(byte, byte[]) Writes the raw message to device. Events RadioResponse Occurs when radio response has been received.
